meanings.definition: A competition or game in which people or teams compete against each other.
meanings.sent1: The school held a contest to see who could run the fastest.
meanings.sent2: She won first place in the singing contest.
meanings.sent3: The contest for the best Halloween costume was fierce.
meanings.sent4: The contest between the two siblings for the last cookie was intense.
meanings.sent5: The spelling contest was a great opportunity to show off her skills.

meanings.definition: To engage in a competition or rivalry.
meanings.sent1: They will contest in the final round of the tournament.
meanings.sent2: The two friends decided to contest in a friendly game of chess.
meanings.sent3: He likes to contest with his brother over who can finish their chores first.
meanings.sent4: The athletes will contest for the gold medal in the upcoming race.
meanings.sent5: She will contest against the reigning champion in the tennis match.

meanings.sent1: She plans to contest the decision made by the committee.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer will contest the evidence presented in court.
meanings.sent3: He likes to contest his friends' opinions just for fun.
meanings.sent4: The siblings often contest each other's choices in movies.
meanings.sent5: The student will contest the grade given by the teacher for the essay.
